attributes.action: Enforce a no detriment policy for all universities across the uk
attributes.additional_details: Students cannot produce the same level of high standard work when they are forced to work from home or online. Not every student had access to working Internet or useful resources and most campuses are closed with no access to their facilities. The response of some universities has been poor and communication has left most student in the dark. Mental health and wellbeing of student has been impacted because of this, which also has an impact on how they work and the quality of work produced.
attributes.background: To stop students from becoming disadvantaged. Students haven't been given the same support as primary, secondary and a level student. Student are still expected to produce the same level of work to high standards without consideration for home life and ability to work online with no other resources

rejection.details:
Decisions about university teaching, assessments and exams are a matter for individual universities, not the UK Government or Parliament.

If you have concerns about your university's arrangements for teaching and assessment you should raise these with your university or the Office for Students, which regulates the higher education sector.

We understand that the current situation is stressful for many people, including students. Student Minds, a mental health charity for students, is collating guidance and developing resources to support students experiencing stress as a result of the current situation, which you may find useful: https://www.studentminds.org.uk/coronavirus.html
